title: POI S5E02 SNAFU, p4 [Root]
author: Root & Shaw
comment: This was literally the the best series I have ever watched
That was one ugly shirt Reese was wearing! No wonder Finch laughed at that. Of course it would probably be hard not to laugh at that or Root's girl scout getup.
why fusco's box was white here? he's off the assets list?

Had to stop watching, when she handed "Harold" a laryngoscope and expected him to insert an endotrachial tube. That is a highly specialized skill set, and even Advanced Emergency Medical Technicians  (Paramedics) have been known to be unsuccessful attempting this in the field. Trust me , I know.
description:
Finch and Root convince The Machine they are not threats. 

Episode summary:
With the Machine now fully decompressed and Root unable to go above ground until the Machine can reinstate her rotating identities, Finch decides to use Reese and Fusco to run a surveillance test. Following malfunctions in the facial recognition system, Reese and Finch steal 64 next-generation graphics-processing GPU blade servers which, once connected to the networked PlayStation 3s, Finch and Root use to reboot the Machine at full power. When the Machine shows signs that it's failing to place threats in context, Root and Finch have it run a contextual background on them, leading to it identifying them as threats, and locking them out of the system. The Machine has lost the ability to differentiate between past and present, so is forced to relive the 42 times Finch killed it and unable to determine that Root and Reese have changed. With Reese waylaid by an assassin the Machine has sent after him, Root puts herself under an anaesthetic so the Machine cannot use her cochlear implant against her, and Finch has to convince the Machine that he and the rest of the team are not a threat. Upon the Machine's first reboot, it provided 30 different numbers, most of whom were not involved in violent crimes; however, one of those numbers, Jeff Blackwell (Josh Close), an ex-con with a violent past, was dismissed as someone who was not involved in any nefarious activity, only to be recruited by Samaritan.

May 9, 2016
